description: Infers a schema by evaluating sample records on the specified streaming source (Amazon Kinesis stream or Amazon Kinesis Firehose delivery stream) or S3 object. In the response, the operation returns the inferred schema and also the sample records that the operation used to infer the schema. You can use the inferred schema when configuring a streaming source for your application. For conceptual information, see Configuring Application Input. Note that when you create an application using the Amazon Kinesis Analytics console, the console uses this operation to infer a schema and show it in the console user interface. This operation requires permissions to perform the kinesisanalytics:DiscoverInputSchema action.

parameters.name: InputStartingPositionConfiguration
parameters.description: Point at which you want Amazon Kinesis Analytics to start reading records from the specified streaming source discovery purposes. InputStartingPosition (string) --- The starting position on the stream. NOW - Start reading just after the most recent record in the stream, start at the request time stamp that the customer issued. TRIM_HORIZON - Start reading at the last untrimmed record in the stream, which is the oldest record available in the stream. This option is not available for an Amazon Kinesis Firehose delivery stream. LAST_STOPPED_POINT - Resume reading from where the application last stopped reading.

nested_params.name: InputStartingPosition
nested_params.description: The starting position on the stream.

parameters.name: S3Configuration
parameters.description: Specify this parameter to discover a schema from data in an Amazon S3 object. IAM ARN of the role used to access the data. ARN of the S3 bucket that contains the data. The name of the object that contains the data.

nested_params.name: RoleARN
nested_params.description: IAM ARN of the role used to access the data.

nested_params.name: BucketARN
nested_params.description: ARN of the S3 bucket that contains the data.

nested_params.name: FileKey
nested_params.description: The name of the object that contains the data.

parameters.name: InputProcessingConfiguration
parameters.description: The InputProcessingConfiguration to use to preprocess the records before discovering the schema of the records. The InputLambdaProcessor that is used to preprocess the records in the stream before being processed by your application code. The ARN of the AWS Lambda function that operates on records in the stream. The ARN of the IAM role that is used to access the AWS Lambda function.

nested_params.name: InputLambdaProcessor
nested_params.description: The InputLambdaProcessor that is used to preprocess the records in the stream before being processed by your application code.

nested_params.name: ResourceARN
nested_params.description: The ARN of the AWS Lambda function that operates on records in the stream.

nested_params.name: RoleARN
nested_params.description: The ARN of the IAM role that is used to access the AWS Lambda function.

nested_items.name: InputSchema
nested_items.description: Schema inferred from the streaming source. It identifies the format of the data in the streaming source and how each data element maps to corresponding columns in the in-application stream that you can create.

nested_items.name: RecordFormat
nested_items.description: Specifies the format of the records on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordFormatType
nested_items.description: The type of record format.

nested_items.name: MappingParameters
nested_items.description: When configuring application input at the time of creating or updating an application, provides additional mapping information specific to the record format (such as JSON, CSV, or record fields delimited by some delimiter) on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: JSONMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when JSON is the record format on the streaming source.

nested_items.name: RecordRowPath
nested_items.description: Path to the top-level parent that contains the records.

nested_items.name: CSVMappingParameters
nested_items.description: Provides additional mapping information when the record format uses delimiters (for example, CSV).

nested_items.name: RecordRowDelimiter
nested_items.description: Row delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, --n' is the typical row delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordColumnDelimiter
nested_items.description: Column delimiter. For example, in a CSV format, a comma (',') is the typical column delimiter.

nested_items.name: RecordEncoding
nested_items.description: Specifies the encoding of the records in the streaming source. For example, UTF-8.

nested_items.name: RecordColumns
nested_items.description: A list of RecordColumn objects.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: Name of the column created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: Mapping
nested_items.description: Reference to the data element in the streaming input or the reference data source. This element is required if the RecordFormatType is JSON.

nested_items.name: SqlType
nested_items.description: Type of column created in the in-application input stream or reference table.

nested_items.name: ParsedInputRecords
nested_items.description: An array of elements, where each element corresponds to a row in a stream record (a stream record can have more than one row).
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ProcessedInputRecords
nested_items.description: Stream data that was modified by the processor specified in the InputProcessingConfiguration parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: RawInputRecords
nested_items.description: Raw stream data that was sampled to infer the schema.
(string) ---
